00025 /**
00026  * Multi-process usage support for ApplicationPool.
00027  *
00028  * ApplicationPoolServer implements a client/server architecture for ApplicationPool.
00029  * This allows one to use ApplicationPool in a multi-process environment (unlike
00030  * StandardApplicationPool). The cache/pool data is stored in the server. Different
00031  * processes can then access the pool through the server.
00032  *
00033  * ApplicationPoolServer itself does not inherit ApplicationPool. Instead, it returns
00034  * an ApplicationPool object via the connect() call. For example:
00035  * @code
00036  *   // Create an ApplicationPoolServer.
00037  *   ApplicationPoolServer server(...);
00038  *   
00039  *   // Now fork a child process, like Apache's prefork MPM eventually will.
00040  *   pid_t pid = fork();
00041  *   if (pid == 0) {
00042  *       // Child process
00043  *       
00044  *       // Connect to the server. After connection, we have an ApplicationPool
00045  *       // object!
00046  *       ApplicationPoolPtr pool(server.connect());
00047  *
00048  *       // The child process doesn't run a server (only the parent process does)
00049  *       // so we call detach to free the server resources (things like file
00050  *       // descriptors).
00051  *       server.detach();
00052  *
00053  *       ApplicationPool::SessionPtr session(pool->get("/home/webapps/foo"));
00054  *       do_something_with(session);
00055  *
00056  *       _exit(0);
00057  *   } else {
00058  *       // Parent process
00059  *       waitpid(pid, NULL, 0);
00060  *   }
00061  * @endcode
00062  *
00063  * @warning
00064  *   ApplicationPoolServer uses threads internally. Threads will disappear after a fork(),
00065  *   so ApplicationPoolServer will become usable after a fork(). So in case of Apache with
00066  *   the prefork MPM, be sure to create an ApplicationPoolServer() <em>after</em> Apache
00067  *   has daemonized.
00068  *
00069  * <h2>Implementation notes</h2>
00070  * Notice that ApplicationPoolServer does do not use TCP sockets at all, or even named Unix
00071  * sockets, depite being a server that can handle multiple clients! So ApplicationPoolServer
00072  * will expose no open ports or temporary Unix socket files. Only child processes are able
00073  * to use the ApplicationPoolServer.
00074  *
00075  * This is implemented through anonymous Unix sockets (<tt>socketpair()</tt>) and file descriptor
00076  * passing. It allows one to emulate <tt>accept()</tt>. During initialization,
00077  * ApplicationPoolServer creates a pair of Unix sockets, one called <tt>serverSocket</tt>
00078  * and the other called <tt>connectSocket</tt>. There is a thread which continuously
00079  * listens on serverSocket for incoming data. The data itself is not important, because it
00080  * only serves to wake up the thread. ApplicationPoolServer::connect() sends some data through
00081  * connectSocket, which wakes up the server thread. The server thread will then create
00082  * a pair of Unix sockets. One of them is passed through serverSocket. The other will be
00083  * handled by a newly created client thread. So the socket that was passed through serverSocket
00084  * is the client's connection to the server, while the other socket is the server's connection
00085  * to the client.
00086  *
00087  * Note that serverSocket and connectSocket are solely used for setting up new connections
00088  * ala accept(). They are not used for any actual data. In fact, they cannot be used in any
00089  * other way without some sort of synchronization mechanism, because all child processes
00090  * are connected to the same serverSocket. In contrast, ApplicationPool::connect() sets up
00091  * a private communicate channel between the server and the current child process.
00092  *
00093  * Also note that each client is handled by a seperate thread. This is necessary because
00094  * ApplicationPoolServer internally uses StandardApplicationPool, and the current algorithm
00095  * for StandardApplicationPool::get() can block (in the case that the spawning limit has
00096  * been exceeded). While it is possible to get around this problem without using threads,
00097  * a thread-based implementation is easier to write.
00098  *
00099  * @ingroup Support
00100  */
00101 class ApplicationPoolServer {
00102 private:
00103         /**
00104          * Contains data shared between RemoteSession and Client.
00105          * Since RemoteSession and Client have different life times, i.e. one may be
00106          * destroyed before the other, they both use a smart pointer that points to
00107          * a SharedData. This way, the SharedData object is only destroyed when
00108          * both the RemoteSession and the Client object has been destroyed.
00109          */
00110         struct SharedData {
00111                 /**
00112                  * The socket connection to the server, as was established by
00113                  * ApplicationPoolServer::connect().
00114                  */
00115                 int server;
00116                 
00117                 ~SharedData() {
00118                         close(server);
00119                 }
00120         };
00121         
00122         typedef shared_ptr<SharedData> SharedDataPtr;

00171         /**
00172          * An ApplicationPool implementation that works together with ApplicationPoolServer.
00173          * It doesn't do much by itself, its job is mostly to forward queries/commands to
00174          * the server and returning the result. Most of the logic is in the server.

00176         class Client: public ApplicationPool {
00177         private:
00178                 SharedDataPtr data;
00179                 
00180         public:
00181                 /**
00182                  * Create a new Client.
00183                  *
00184                  * @param sock The newly established socket connection with the ApplicationPoolServer.

00186                 Client(int sock) {
00187                         data = ptr(new SharedData());
00188                         data->server = sock;
00189                 }
00190                 
00191                 virtual void setMax(unsigned int max) {
00192                         MessageChannel channel(data->server);
00193                         channel.write("setMax", toString(max).c_str(), NULL);
00194                 }
00195                 
00196                 virtual unsigned int getActive() const {
00197                         MessageChannel channel(data->server);
00198                         vector<string> args;
00199                         
00200                         channel.write("getActive", NULL);
00201                         channel.read(args);
00202                         return atoi(args[0].c_str());
00203                 }
00204                 
00205                 virtual unsigned int getCount() const {
00206                         MessageChannel channel(data->server);
00207                         vector<string> args;
00208                         
00209                         channel.write("getCount", NULL);
00210                         channel.read(args);
00211                         return atoi(args[0].c_str());
00212                 }
00213                 
00214                 virtual Application::SessionPtr get(const string &appRoot, const string &user = "", const string &group = "") {
00215                         MessageChannel channel(data->server);
00216                         vector<string> args;
00217                         int reader, writer;
00218                         
00219                         channel.write("get", appRoot.c_str(), user.c_str(), group.c_str(), NULL);
00220                         channel.read(args);
00221                         reader = channel.readFileDescriptor();
00222                         writer = channel.readFileDescriptor();
00223                         return ptr(new RemoteSession(data, atoi(args[0].c_str()), reader, writer));
00224                 }

00233                 /** The thread which handles the client. */

00255         /**
00256          * The entry point of the server thread which sets up private connections.
00257          * See the class overview's implementation notes for details.
00258          */
00259         void serverThreadMainLoop() {
00260                 while (!done) {
00261                         int fds[2], ret;
00262                         char x;
00263                         
00264                         // The received data only serves to wake up the server socket,
00265                         // and is not important.
00266                         do {
00267                                 ret = read(serverSocket, &x, 1);
00268                         } while (ret == -1 && errno == EINTR);
00269                         if (ret == 0) {
00270                                 break;
00271                         }
00272                         
00273                         socketpair(AF_UNIX, SOCK_STREAM, 0, fds);
00274                         MessageChannel(serverSocket).writeFileDescriptor(fds[1]);
00275                         close(fds[1]);
00276                         
00277                         ClientInfoPtr info(new ClientInfo());
00278                         info->fd = fds[0];
00279                         info->thr = new thread(bind(&ApplicationPoolServer::clientThreadMainLoop, this, info));
00280                         mutex::scoped_lock l(lock);
00281                         clients.insert(info);
00282                 }
00283         }
00284         
00285         /**
00286          * The entry point of a thread which handles exactly one client.
00287          */
00288         void clientThreadMainLoop(ClientInfoPtr client) {
00289                 MessageChannel channel(client->fd);
00290                 vector<string> args;
00291                 map<int, Application::SessionPtr> sessions;
00292                 int lastID = 0;
00293 
00294                 while (!done) {
00295                         if (!channel.read(args)) {
00296                                 break;
00297                         }
00298                         
00299                         if (args[0] == "get" && args.size() == 4) {
00300                                 Application::SessionPtr session(pool.get(args[1], args[2], args[3]));
00301                                 channel.write(toString(lastID).c_str(), NULL);
00302                                 channel.writeFileDescriptor(session->getReader());
00303                                 channel.writeFileDescriptor(session->getWriter());
00304                                 session->closeReader();
00305                                 session->closeWriter();
00306                                 sessions[lastID] = session;
00307                                 lastID++;
00308                         } else if (args[0] == "close" && args.size() == 2) {
00309                                 sessions.erase(atoi(args[1].c_str()));
00310                         } else if (args[0] == "setMax") {
00311                                 pool.setMax(atoi(args[1].c_str()));
00312                         } else if (args[0] == "getActive") {
00313                                 channel.write(toString(pool.getActive()).c_str(), NULL);
00314                         } else if (args[0] == "getCount") {
00315                                 channel.write(toString(pool.getCount()).c_str(), NULL);
00316                         }
00317                 }
00318                 
00319                 mutex::scoped_lock l(lock);
00320                 clients.erase(client);
00321         }

00324         /**
00325          * Create a new ApplicationPoolServer object.
00326          *
00327          * @param spawnServerCommand The filename of the spawn server to use.
00328          * @param logFile Specify a log file that the spawn server should use.
00329          *            Messages on its standard output and standard error channels
00330          *            will be written to this log file. If an empty string is
00331          *            specified, no log file will be used, and the spawn server
00332          *            will use the same standard output/error channels as the
00333          *            current process.
00334          * @param environment The RAILS_ENV environment that all RoR applications
00335          *            should use. If an empty string is specified, the current value
00336          *            of the RAILS_ENV environment variable will be used.
00337          * @param rubyCommand The Ruby interpreter's command.
00338          * @throws SystemException An error occured while trying to setup the spawn server
00339          *            or the server socket.
00340          * @throws IOException The specified log file could not be opened.
00341          */
00342         ApplicationPoolServer(const string &spawnServerCommand,
00343                      const string &logFile = "",
00344                      const string &environment = "production",
00345                      const string &rubyCommand = "ruby")
00346         : pool(spawnServerCommand, logFile, environment, rubyCommand) {
00347                 int fds[2];
00348                 
00349                 if (socketpair(AF_UNIX, SOCK_STREAM, 0, fds) == -1) {
00350                         throw SystemException("Cannot create a Unix socket pair", errno);
00351                 }
00352                 serverSocket = fds[0];
00353                 connectSocket = fds[1];
00354                 done = false;
00355                 detached = false;
00356                 serverThread = new thread(bind(&ApplicationPoolServer::serverThreadMainLoop, this));
00357         }
00358         
00359         ~ApplicationPoolServer() {
00360                 if (!detached) {
00361                         done = true;
00362                         close(connectSocket);
00363                         serverThread->join();
00364                         delete serverThread;
00365                         close(serverSocket);
00366                         
00367                         set<ClientInfoPtr> clientsCopy;
00368                         {
00369                                 mutex::scoped_lock l(lock);
00370                                 clientsCopy = clients;
00371                         }
00372                         set<ClientInfoPtr>::iterator it;
00373                         for (it = clientsCopy.begin(); it != clientsCopy.end(); it++) {
00374                                 (*it)->thr->join();
00375                         }
00376                 }
00377         }
00378         
00379         /**
00380          * Connects to the server and returns a usable ApplicationPool object.
00381          * All cache/pool data of this ApplicationPool is actually stored on the server
00382          * and shared with other clients, but that is totally transparent.
00383          *
00384          * @throws SystemException Something went wrong.
00385          * @throws IOException Something went wrong.
00386          */
00387         ApplicationPoolPtr connect() {
00388                 MessageChannel channel(connectSocket);
00389                 int fd;
00390                 
00391                 // Write some random data to wake up the server.
00392                 channel.writeRaw("x", 1);
00393                 
00394                 fd = channel.readFileDescriptor();
00395                 return ptr(new Client(fd));
00396         }
00397         
00398         /**
00399          * Detach the server by freeing up some server resources such as file descriptors.
00400          * This should be called by child processes that wish to use a server, but do
00401          * not run the server itself.
00402          *
00403          * This method may only be called once. The ApplicationPoolServer object
00404          * will become unusable once detach() has been called.
00405          *
00406          * @warning Never call this method in the process in which this
00407          *    ApplicationPoolServer was created!
00408          */
00409         void detach() {
00410                 detached = true;
00411                 close(connectSocket);
00412                 close(serverSocket);
00413                 #ifdef VALGRIND_FRIENDLY
00414                         delete serverThread;
00415                 #endif
00416                 clients.clear();
00417                 pool.detach();
00418         }
